nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Photosynthetic pathway predominant in many plants, characterized by the Calvin cycle where Rubisco catalyzes CO2 fixation. Sensitive to temperature variations affecting enzymatic activities and regeneration processes.

nodes.label: C4 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Photosynthetic pathway involving a CO2 concentrating mechanism that minimizes Rubisco's oxygenation activity, prevalent in warm and tropical species. Its temperature response differs from C3, with limitations shifting based on temperature.

nodes.label: Rubisco Capacity
nodes.description: Maximum carboxylation rate of Rubisco enzyme, dominant limitation in C3 plants at low temperatures and low CO2 levels; its activity declines with increasing temperature due to thermal lability.

nodes.label: Pi Regeneration
nodes.description: Process involving regeneration of inorganic phosphate necessary for ATP synthesis during photosynthesis; becomes a limiting factor at higher temperatures in C3 plants.

nodes.label: Electron Transport Chain
nodes.description: Series of protein complexes facilitating electron flow from water to NADP+, producing ATP and NADPH; limitations increase at elevated temperatures, affecting photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Rubisco Activase
nodes.description: Chaperone enzyme that facilitates Rubisco activation; heat-induced lability reduces its effectiveness at high temperatures, impacting photosynthesis especially in C3 plants.

nodes.label: Thermal Optimum for Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Temperature at which photosynthetic rate peaks; varies with growth conditions and acclimation, typically between 0–45°C depending on species and habitat.

nodes.label: Acclimation to Temperature
nodes.description: Adaptive adjustments including increased Pi regeneration capacity, electron transport efficiency, and Rubisco activase stability in C3 plants; in C4 plants, increased Rubisco and C4 cycle enzymes when exposed to cooler conditions.

nodes.label: Chilling Tolerance in C4 Plants
nodes.description: Ability of some C4 species to sustain Rubisco activity and photosynthesis below 20°C, indicating species-specific adaptations to cooler environments.

nodes.label: Global Climate Change
nodes.description: Long-term increase in global temperatures affecting plant physiological processes, leading to shifts in photosynthetic limitations towards electron transport and Rubisco activase constraints.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Limitation Shift
nodes.description: Change in primary biochemical constraints from Rubisco capacity at low temperatures to electron transport and Rubisco activase limitations at higher temperatures, especially under elevated CO2 conditions.

nodes.label: Temperature Ranges for Photosynthesis
nodes.description: Species-specific temperature windows for safe photosynthesis: 0–30°C in cold-adapted, 7–40°C in warm-season crops, 15–45°C in tropical/desert species.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic Efficiency
nodes.description: Rate of photosynthesis relative to optimal conditions; influenced by biochemical limitations, acclimation, and environmental factors such as temperature and CO2 levels.

nodes.label: Modeling and Experimental Methods
nodes.description: Techniques used to understand temperature responses of photosynthesis, including biochemical assays and computational models, improving predictions under climate change scenarios.

nodes.label: Acclimation Mechanisms in C3 Plants
nodes.description: Enhancement of Pi regeneration, electron transport capacity, and Rubisco activase stability to maintain photosynthesis across temperature ranges.

nodes.label: Acclimation in C4 Plants
nodes.description: Increase in Rubisco and C4 cycle enzyme levels when plants from warm habitats are exposed to cooler temperatures, aiding in temperature adaptation.

nodes.label: Future Predictions of Photosynthesis Limitations
nodes.description: Under global warming and elevated CO2, limitations are expected to shift towards electron transport and Rubisco activase, potentially reducing photosynthetic efficiency.

nodes.label: Impact of Global Warming
nodes.description: Rising temperatures are projected to alter the biochemical constraints of photosynthesis, emphasizing the importance of acclimation and adaptation strategies.

nodes.label: Photosynthesis Thermal Range Adaptation
nodes.description: Species-specific adjustments in thermal optimum and biochemical capacities to sustain photosynthesis under changing temperature regimes.

nodes.label: Key Keywords
nodes.description: Acclimation, CO2 and temperature interactions, electron transport, global change, Rubisco, Rubisco activase.
